name: Presidente Inter-Continental Cozumel Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Very relaxing atmosphere, great place to escape to....
reviews.text: Loved the Presedente, was a little concerned before I left because I knew absolutely nothing about the resort. I thought it was beautiful. SO relaxing!! Did some diving and enjoyed myself, saw eels, rays, squid, lobster, many fish, and the water was SO nice and warm. My hubby and I where looking for a resort to unwind from our busy work lives at home, and this did the trick. It was so quiet, no phones, pagers, traffic... The resort had a certain calmness to it. Hard to find. The food was really good at the restaurant on the property. We ate there quite a bit. Happy hour from 5-7 daily. Watched the sunset every night at happy hour. Will miss the presidente, the wonderful blue water, and the laid back, casual lifestyle. Hope to visit again someday soon!

This hotel offers a peacefulness that comes with the hotel's goal of being a vacation haven. There are no sales people trying to hype the place as a time share, no pressure tactics to tour and buy, no "give away" deals that come with fine print obligations. It offers comfortable accommodations with some elegance. The location is private and quiet. The buildings are stylish and attractive. The beaches are well maintained and offer a range of lounging choices. The pool is large. The snorkeling, right off the beach, is fantastic. If all you did every day was hang out right there, you'd have a first-class Cozumel experience. It's a taxi ride anywhere if you don't rent a car, but you'll want to sightsee more of the island, trying local cuisine, shopping, and seeing the wide open stretches of water and sand on the east side. (We recommend the funky, friendly bar at Chen Rio for cervezas on a hot afternoon). Forget the all-inclusives on Cozumel. At the Presidente, you'll feel like- well, a king or queen!
reviews.title: where relaxation rules!
Cozumel Paradise
reviews.text: We just got back from an awesome week at Presidente InterContinental in Cozumel. Before we left we were curious to see how the hotel really is since people’s reviews on here are so extreme – either they love it or hate it. Now that we’ve been there, we don’t see how anyone could hate it.

reviews.title: Great vacation
reviews.text: The staff was always very pleasant and responsive. I don’t think we ever passed a staff member who did not greet us in some way. The room was very clean and nice. I’ve seen people say it’s not “decorated” enough. My thought on that is that I’m glad the rooms aren’t overly opulent – why would you want to detract from the incredible view outside the room. Look out the window, go outside, sit by the ocean – what better atmosphere could you ask for. A few people complained that the maids came TOO frequently. The maids did come more than we’re used to in the states, but let me tell you, it’s nice to get new towels in the afternoon if you’ve already soaked up the morning ones. If we didn’t want them coming in the room, we just put out the privacy sign – simple as that.

reviews.title: Worth the Money
reviews.text: The restaurant on the beach was not our favorite; we thought the food was mediocre and overpriced. However, we certainly enjoyed the food served at the bar and in the little hut by Scuba Du. Basically if you order off the little sailboat menu, you’ll enjoy your meal. We discovered that ordering from the sailboat menu from under our beach umbrella was the best way to go for lunch after a dive – easy, tasty, and economical. Alfredo’s was excellent too, we actually went there twice on our trip, and it was great both times.

Having spent more than $5000 on two rooms for five days at the Hotel Intercontinental I felt taken. Sound insulation in our room was poor; could hear our neighbors coming in and out at night. Maid service was uneven; only once did we get turn down service and soiled dishes were not removed for several days. We had one big rain with lots of wind and water poured into our room through the patio door. While breakfast were satisfactory, the food at the main outdoor restaurant was mediocre at best - mostly gummy steam table fare at unreasonably high prices. The hotel's towel policy was demanding despite our paying the resot surcharge - if you failed to return the towel card or the towel on checking out you would be charged $45 per towel; I felt put upon wrangling the towels of two adults and two kids during my stay so as to avoid the fine. The exercise room is teeny with a waiting line (and pretty poor equipment). Scuba Du - the inhouse dive shop - appeared to regularly overcharge by converting rates from pesos to dollars back to pesos at different rates (so the 10 peso daily national park fee was converted into $1 and then we were charged 12 pesos because that was the rate used at that stage). The only redeeming part of this hotel is the location which abuts great waters for snorkeling. Front desk service was also nothing to right home about; by phone from the US they could not confirm whether TelCel - a local cellular phone service allied with Cingular - worked on the hotel grounds (it does) and they steered hotel guests to an overpriced restaurant (the diners mostly seemed to be fellow hotel guests) in twon whose seafood was not fresh and whose service was surly (apparently some sort of referral sysyetm was going on which did not reflect well on the hotel's integrity). All in all poor value.
reviews.title: Great Snorkeling, Otherwise Poor Value
Best kept secret is Presidente InterContinental Cozumel
reviews.text: Definitely the crown jewel of the island for location, activities, dining, and the best sunset views!!! Save your $$ and stay at this hotel it has the best beach for snorkeling & swimming without having to mess with a taxi,

The rooms are very nice and have private patios with views of beautiful gardens or ocean views which are amazing, we chose the garden view and saved about $400.00 since we would be dinning out during the sunset hours. The restaurant is great and has the same or better quality than most for food, but the view is truly amazing at this hotel so I recommend dinning here. Also the breakfast, lunch & dinning is very resonable in price and consider the savings of not messing with a taxi + tip. We found out that the taxi fares are not $5.00 but varied more like $15.00-$20.00 for family of four to dine out and the other restaurants did not have a nice ambiance nor view and food was not better. My 6yr & 8 yr loved the snorkeling off the pool area and the poolside ceramic painting was excellent for all ages to enjoy. The ceramics would get fired that night and you have your art returned next morning with beautiful high gloss, and prices range according to size of piece: $5.00-$20.00 USD.
reviews.title: Learn to relax
Our family truly enjoyed our peaceful vacation at the Classy Presidente!
reviews.text: I just returned from PI on April 25 also. I stayed in room 5130 (interesting that the previous review stayed in the room right next to mine). I would agree that the rooms were very clean. I would rate the maid service as clean but slow. Indeed they (she) was in my room for a minimum of 2 hours every day at all hours. Never really consistent in timing of cleaning. Sometimes 2 hours beginning at 10am and then other days cleaning would begin at 4pm.

reviews.title: not for me
reviews.text: Room service was attentive and prompt.
We just returned from nine days at the PI. Here is our bottom line:
reviews.title: Our Review of the PI
Beautiful, a little expensive
reviews.text: ROOM: We were in room #5131, a beachfront suite. Originally I had booked an oceanfront room, and I joined the Ambassador club abd was upgraded to this room class. The room was not posh, but fine for our needs. It is not a five-star hotel room. It is not sumptious. But it was IMMACUTLATE: I have newver seen maids clean as thoroughly as the ones here at the Presidente. My goodness, the cleaning crew must have spent two hours a day scrubbing the room. This is not the Ritz-Carlton or the Fiesta AMericana Grand Coral Beach in Cancun, I don't know why it was awarded the AAA four-diamond award. But it was great for our needs.

The location of the room was fantastic- steps from the coean. We would get up, roll out of bed and spend the day on the beach snorleing. If we forgot our sunblock it was no big deal: the room was about 100 ft away from our beach chairs! Our room was also across from the health club and spa, which was great as I run everyday.
reviews.title: All around magnificent - better than ever
Absolutely Wonderful!
reviews.text: RESTAURANTS:

We had wonderful dinning experiences at both El Caribeno and Alfredo di Roma. ALthought not cheap, both the food and service were excellent. Outdoors, there were quite a few flies at El Carriebe. It varied from day to day. But of course, this is not hte fault of the restaurant. Also, we were not AI.
reviews.title: Ignore the reviews that are 100% negative. This place isn't that bad.

reviews.text: My husband, our 3-year-old son and I just returned from a 5-night stay at the InterContinental Cozumel (June 2005).
reviews.title: A Bit Disappointed
best vacation ever!!
reviews.text: We really only found 2 big positives with this hotel.

reviews.title: Full Blown indepth Report
reviews.text: 1. Even though the beach is small, the snorkeling off of it is truly AMAZING.

reviews.title: Good hotel - great shore snorkelling
reviews.text: 2. The staff is very friendly and most helpful.

reviews.title: They could of helped
reviews.text: OUR ROOM:

description: Presidente InterContinental Cozumel Resort & Spa is the perfect balance of energy and ease. Adventurers love the scuba centre and nearby Chankanaab Park. Bringing the kids? The resort s Chiqui Club will keep them busy all day. When you want a slightly slower pace, you can head for our stretch of white sand, the exotic Mandara Spa or Cozumel s shops.After a 25 million dollar investment, this resort offers upgraded facilities and a unique vacation experience for the discerning traveler. The place to discover three experiences: great Dive, unique Spa treatments and Golf.
